column2: When it is necessary for two trains to cross at Ledbury they should arrive a minimum of 3 minutes apart. If this isnot possible then see below for ‘Adjustments’
Down Direction – applies only when there is atrain in the section between Shelwick Jn andLedbury at the time the Down train isscheduled to arrive in Ledbury

Up Direction – applies only when there is:i) a train in the section between Malvern Wellsand Ledbury; orii) an ECS movement required to reverse atMalvern Wells that is timed to be betweenNewlands East and Malvern Wells when theUp train is approaching Ledbury.
NW1001 ARMITAGE JN (INCLUSIVE) TO PRESTON FYLDE JN
Trains from the Up Slow and Up Fast crossingto the Up & Down Cannock
Up trains from Stone joining the Up Slow or UpFast at Colwich Jn
Minimum Turnround Time – Trains changing direction at end of journey
All Down trains crossing Down Slow to DownFast
column3: Approach Control for 30mph Crossover andacceleration allowance
